__e: Hey, if that's how you want to justify a night of passion,
Henry. I know, but I can't defend a situation where I had no choice.
I don't feel justified in wasting further time.
So are you honestly saying that you would be here trying to justify what he has done if he was not your husband?
And there's nothing you can say that will ever justify what happened to her.
We got you and now you gotta do something to justify what's going on in your head.
Dr. Carter, I can't justify an expenditure of $5000 a day on a patient who should not be alive, does not want to be alive.
I've been straight up lying to my friends because I don't want to have to defend dating you, and every time I spend the night,
I don't have to justify who I am. There are things I don't want to tell him!
And with no other gates in range, you don't know how to explain to everyone else why the ship has stopped.
If you think I'm just going to stand by and watch as you use my father's death to justify murder, then you don't know me at all.
I understand your need to, sort of, think of your father as someone giving a gift, but I really can't see how there's any kind of justification in that much murder and that much destruction.
I don't have to justify my orders to you, and you do have to follow them.
I don't think the ends always justify the means, but if no one's hurt and if it's good for Earth, I've got no complaints.
To justify the things you did if you see me as a monster.
Do you want the truth or only words to justify your evil?
Look, I know this looks bad, and I feel horrible, and I know nothing I could say to you could possibly justify why I slept with Bill except...
We have seen more suffering than any man should ever see and if there is going to be an end to it, it must be an end that justifies the cost.
